title: Why AI Didn’t Stop Me From Learning to Code
text:
It was June of 2022 when I first decided to delve (back) into mathematics and computation. This was induced by the fact that biology has been turning into a computational field of sorts due to the advent of high throughput sequencing and advanced simulation capabilities. Biology provides a wealth of information unlike any other, and statistical methods applied through computation and code are shaping up to be the future of the entire field

title: Who Am I?
text: I’m Ammar Aldawood, an aspiring computational biologist. A medical laboratory sciences alumnus from Jordan University of Science and Technology, I became increasingly aware of how indispensible mathematics and computation are for understanding biology.

title: What I’m Reading
text:
This is a collection of books, papers and writings that I think are particularly insightful. I read a lot more than what is listed here, but those are more deliberate readings compared to most of the reading that I do everyday, which can be quite arbitrary and hard to keep track of.
